text:
ERIK DEMAINE: To me, the key
to teaching algorithms well

is just be excited
about the material.

I think if you personally think
these algorithms are really

cool and like, wow, how
did they come up with this,

and wow, I mean, look how this
thing interacts with this thing

and magically it
all runs super fast,

students pick up on
it really quickly

and themselves get engaged in
the material and care-- care

So I just try to have
fun with the material

and encourage the students to
similarly have fun learning it.

But a lot of the
material in this class

So it's mostly board
work and trying

to draw representative
figures and things like that.
